meanings.definition: Correspondence in the sounds of the ends of words or lines of verse.
meanings.sent1: The rhime at the end of the poem made it sound nice.
meanings.sent2: The poet used rhime to make the verses flow smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The rhime in the song was so catchy, it stuck in my head all day.
meanings.sent4: Her rhime echoed through the room, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The rhime added a musical quality to the writing.

meanings.definition: A word agreeing with another in terminal sound.
meanings.sent1: In the rhime, 'cat' and 'hat' have the same ending sound.
meanings.sent2: The rhime 'moon' perfectly matched with 'tune' in the poem.
meanings.sent3: The rhime between 'love' and 'dove' was quite lovely.
meanings.sent4: The rhime of 'bake' and 'cake' created a harmonious effect.
meanings.sent5: The rhime of 'blue' and 'true' added a poetic touch.

meanings.sent1: She loves to rhime in her free time.
meanings.sent2: He rhimes beautifully, creating captivating poetry.
meanings.sent3: I tried to rhime, but my words got all mixed up!
meanings.sent4: Rhiming requires creativity and a good ear for sounds.
meanings.sent5: The poet rhimed effortlessly, weaving words into art.
